intro: Acourtia durangensis, commonly known as the Durango acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Acourtia durangensis is considered a rare and endemic species.
